 Run the bounded map-reduce operation.

Detailed Description

template<typename T, unsigned int D, unsigned int BoundCheckFreq = 1, unsigned int i = 0, unsigned int NextCheck = BoundCheckFreq>
struct kche_tree::BoundedMapReduce< T, D, BoundCheckFreq, i, NextCheck >

Provide a bounded generic map-reduce operation over two arrays using template metaprogramming techniques. This version of the operation allows to check the boundaries in a specific frequency without the need of runtime conditionals.

Template Parameters:
TType of the data in the input arrays.
DNumber of dimensions in the input arrays.
BoundCheckFreqFrequency of the boundary checks. Defaults to 1, which means to check every 1 dimensions (always). Should never be 0.
iFirst dimension to operate. Defaults to 0.
NextCheckIterations left until the next boundary check. Defaults to BoundCheckFreq.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T , unsigned int D, unsigned int BoundCheckFreq = 1, unsigned int i = 0, unsigned int NextCheck = BoundCheckFreq>
template<typename MapFunctor , typename ReduceFunctor , typename BoundaryFunctor >
static T kche_tree::BoundedMapReduce< T, D, BoundCheckFreq, i, NextCheck >::run ( const MapFunctor &  map,
const ReduceFunctor &  reduce,
const BoundaryFunctor &  check,
const T *  a,
const T *  b,
T  boundary,
T  value = Traits<T>::zero() 
) [inline, static]

Run the bounded map-reduce operation.

Parameters:
mapFunctor used to map the corresponding element in the input arrays to some single value.
reduceFunctor used to fold the results of each map operation across dimensions.
checkFunctor used for checking the boundaries. Should return true when the boundary is crossed. First argument will be the current accumulated value, second will be the boundary argument.
aFirst input array.
bSecond input array.
boundaryBoundary value used to avoid unnecessary calculations.
valueInitial accumulation value. Defaults to the zero traits.
